org.jruyi.io

Interface IFilter<I,O>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the in-bound message passed to onMsgArrive(org.jruyi.io.ISession, I, org.jruyi.io.IFilterOutput)
    O - the type of the out-bound message passed to onMsgDepart(org.jruyi.io.ISession, O, org.jruyi.io.IFilterOutput)
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Filter

    public interface IFilter<I,O>
    A filter is in charge of splitting the incoming data into messages, and performs filtering tasks on both incoming and outgoing messages.
    See Also:
    IFilterOutput, Filter

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int E_ERROR
      Fail to parse the length of a message
      static int E_UNDERFLOW
      Indicates that more data is needed to parse out the length of a message.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int msgMinSize()
      Returns the minimum size of a message, usually the number of bytes that are adequate to tell the length of the whole message.
      boolean onMsgArrive(ISession session, I msg, IFilterOutput output)
      Filters the incoming data which is passed from the left most filter to the right most filter in the chain in order.
      boolean onMsgDepart(ISession session, O msg, IFilterOutput output)
      Filters the outgoing data which is passed from the right most filter to the left most filter in the chain in order.
      int tellBoundary(ISession session, IBuffer in)
      Returns the message length by reading and parsing the specified bufferReader.

    • Field Detail

    • Method Detail

      • msgMinSize

        int msgMinSize()
        Returns the minimum size of a message, usually the number of bytes that are adequate to tell the length of the whole message.
        Returns:
        the minimum size of a message
        Since:
        2.0

      • tellBoundary

        int tellBoundary(ISession session,
                 IBuffer in)
        Returns the message length by reading and parsing the specified bufferReader.
        Parameters:
        session - the current IO session
        in - a byte sequence to be parsed
        Returns:
        E_ERROR to discard the data due to any errors. The specified session will be closed after this method returns.
        E_UNDERFLOW if the underlying raw data of the given in is not sufficient to parse out the message length, which means that more data needs to be read

      • onMsgArrive

        boolean onMsgArrive(ISession session,
                    I msg,
                    IFilterOutput output)
        Filters the incoming data which is passed from the left most filter to the right most filter in the chain in order. The filtered output is passed onto the next filter via the given output.

        If this method returns true and the output is not empty, then the output will be passed to the next filter's onMsgArrive as input msg.

        If this method returns true and the output is empty, then the filter-chain's onMsgArrive routine will abort.

        If this method returns false and the output is empty, then the filter-chain's onMsgArrive routine will abort and the given session will be closed.

        If this method returns false but the output is returned, then the inbound filter routine stops here and the output will go backward doing outbound filtering.

        Parameters:
        session - the current IO session
        msg - the incoming message
        output - an object used to pass the output to the next filter in the filter chain
        Returns:
        true if going to next filter otherwise false.

      • onMsgDepart

        boolean onMsgDepart(ISession session,
                    O msg,
                    IFilterOutput output)
        Filters the outgoing data which is passed from the right most filter to the left most filter in the chain in order. The filtered output is passed onto the next filter via the given output.

        If this method returns true and the output is not empty, then the output will be passed to the next filter's onMsgDepart as msg.

        If this method returns true and the output is empty, then the filter-chain's onMsgDepart routine will abort.

        If this method returns false, then the filter-chain's onMsgDepart routine will abort.

        Parameters:
        session - the current IO session
        msg - the outgoing message
        output - an object used to pass the output to the next filter in the filter chain
        Returns:
        true if going to the next filter otherwise false
